Represents an acyclic directed graph.

Construct with the given node counts, connection data, layer information, and indexes of the output nodes.

Input node count.

outputCount

Output node count.

Layer information for the acyclic graph.

int[]

Properties
LayerArray
public LayerInfo[] LayerArray { get }

Layer information for the acyclic graph.

The nodes of the graph are arranged into layers, where the layer index (or depth) for a node is defined as the longest path (number of node to node hops) to arrive at that node from an input node, thus input nodes are defined as being in layer zero (depth 0).

OutputNodeIdxArr
public int[] OutputNodeIdxArr { get }

An array containing the node index of each output node.

In acyclic networks the output and hidden nodes are re-ordered by network depth. This array describes the index of each output node in the full set of nodes. Note however that the input nodes *are* in their original positions, as they are defined as being at depth zero and therefore are not moved by the depth based sort.
